sentences.en: Commercial transactions involve extraordinary amounts of legal rigmarole – all implicitly stimulated by our learned friends.
sentences.cn: 商业交易涉及了太多法律上的繁文缛节——这都是那些精通法律的朋友们在暗中推动.

sentences.en: He had to go through the usual rigmarole of signing legal papers in order to complete the business deal.
sentences.cn: 为了达成这笔交易,他不得不一一通过通常的签署法律文件的繁琐程序.

sentences.en: I couldn't be bothered to go through the rigmarole of changing clothes.
sentences.cn: 我不想再费事儿换衣服了。

sentences.en: I couldn't face the whole rigmarole of getting a work permit again.
sentences.cn: 我无法再次面对获取工作许可证所需的各种冗长复杂的手续。

sentences.en: I don’t want to go through the rigmarole of taking him to court.
sentences.cn: 我可不想走那些繁琐的程序去起诉他。

sentences.en: I've never heard such a rigmarole.
sentences.cn: 我从来没听过像这样的长篇废话.

sentences.en: She told me some rigmarole or other about having lost her keys.
sentences.cn: 她向我拉拉杂杂说了一大套关于丢失钥匙的事.

sentences.en: She told me some rigmarole or other having lost her keys.
sentences.cn: 她跟我说了一大堆冗长的废话,说她怎样丢了钥匙等等.

sentences.en: Then the whole rigmarole starts over again.
sentences.cn: 然后，整个漫长复杂的过程又重新开始了。

sentences.en: This rigmarole may provide passing entertainment.
sentences.cn: 这些胡言乱语也许不过是暂时的消遣.

trans.tran_cn: 繁琐的程序，费时的手续，冗长杂乱的讲述
trans.tran_en: a long confusing process or description
